pullRequest.body:
Add definition of convolution of measures on monoids.
Add commutativity of convolution if the monoid is commutative.
Add convolution of measures is finite if both measures are finite.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

This PR is just meant to introduce the definition of convolution of measures, any additions to the API are very welcome! 

Regarding docstring & copyright: I needed to fill this in to make
Github happy, feel free to change.

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body: Feels like this addition would require the alternative definition in terms of integrals to make more progress; I'm in the process of improving my familiarity with these. Once I am feeling confident with these, I'll try to tackle that alternative definition.
@JasonKYi, can you tell me what other aspects I should add to this PR, if any? I'm fine with keeping it small, other additions might perhaps be done when the need for them arises?

> Instead of the MeasureTheory/Constructions folder, you should rather place the file in the MeasureTheory/Group folder.

Done, this (and adding the two requested `simp` tags) is the only modification in the newest PR.

Thanks!
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7943640691/job/21688242643)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7943640691/job/21688242683)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7943640691/job/21688242584)
Instead of the MeasureTheory/Constructions folder, you should rather place the file in the MeasureTheory/Group folder.

It looks good!
A few final minor comments.
Instead of the MeasureTheory/Constructions folder, you should rather place the file in the MeasureTheory/Group folder.

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion (μ : Measure M) (ν : Measure M) (ρ : Measure M) [SFinite μ] [SFinite ν] [SFinite ρ]: ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion (μ : Measure M) (ν : Measure M) (ρ : Measure M) [SFinite μ] [SFinite ν] [SFinite ρ]: ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion (ν : Measure M) [IsFiniteMeasure μ] [IsFiniteMeasure ν] : IsFiniteMeasure (μ.conv ν) := by ```
Can you add a scoped notation in MeasureTheory for this?
Good suggestion, I'll figure out how to do that tomorrow! I think $*$ is a nice candidate, if we don't already have such a notation for measures?
At this point you can probably show that convolution alongside addition forms a semiring
We don't yet have associativity of convolution. I also don't have a proof for that at this point.
@JasonKYi, I'm not sure how much more structure you would need for convolution to become associative? I guess assuming a lot of structure would provide it, but I would like to keep it minimal.

I'm thinking you should do something like [this](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/38c547ff15964e9e2251bd7da687ab8465dfb307/Mathlib/MeasureTheory/Measure/MutuallySingular.lean#L45) so that you only get this notation when you open MeasureTheory
fixed!

Since the definition is called `conv`, you should use `conv` instead of `convolution` in all the lemma names.

What about `dirac_one_conv` for this one?
I'll change that!

When talking about convolution of measures, one usually refers to the additive version. Could you give another name to the multiplicative definition, use to_additive to get an additive convolution, and name that one `conv`?
@RemyDegenne, do you have a good suggestion? An obvious candidate would be `mul_conv`, but that could also refer to something about multiplying and taking convolutions...
The name should not have _ in it. It would rather be something like `mulConv`. The multiplicative version of `abs` is `mabs`. Let's use `mconv`?
The type M and its typeclass assumptions should be declared with a `variable` command at the top of the file
please close the namespace at the end of the file
Turn this into an instance
Can you use the `*` here and below?
Yes!
It looks like this file docstring is still WIP?
That one can probably go, I wouldn't say there is a big "main result" at this point.

If some sections are empty, no need to keep them
```suggestion
```

```suggestion
```

```suggestion
@[to_additive conv_zero]
theorem mconv_zero (μ : Measure M) : (0 : Measure M) * μ = (0 : Measure M) := by
```
Could you add a @[simp] attribute here and on the next lemma? (I forgot how to make it interact correctly with to_additive). The dirac lemmas could be simp as well.

Also could you review the line breaks in all lemmas in the file?
Of course, the way to make it interact is `@[to_additive (attr := simp)]` by the way.
Please make that an instance. Could you also add one for IsProbabilityMeasure? Also, please group the instances together.

```suggestion
/-- Convolution of SFinite maps is SFinite. -/
```

```suggestion
import Mathlib.MeasureTheory.Measure.MeasureSpace

/-!
```

```suggestion
In this file we define and prove properties about the convolutions of two measures.
```
Can you please explain in this file docstring what the convolution is? State that it's the map of + or * on the product.

```suggestion
  rw [MeasureTheory.Measure.dirac_prod, map_map]
```

```suggestion
theorem mconv_zero (μ : Measure M) : (0 : Measure M) * μ = (0 : Measure M) := by
```

```suggestion
theorem zero_mconv (μ : Measure M) : μ * (0 : Measure M) = (0 : Measure M) := by
```

```suggestion
    Measure M := Measure.map (fun x : M × M ↦ x.1 * x.2) (μ.prod ν)
```

```suggestion
    SFinite (μ * ν) := instSFiniteMap (μ.prod ν) fun x ↦ x.1 * x.2
```

The symbol used by wikipedia is
```suggestion
/-- Scoped notation for the multiplicative convolution of measures. -/
scoped[MeasureTheory] infix:80 " ∗ " => MeasureTheory.Measure.mconv

/-- Scoped notation for the additive convolution of measures. -/
scoped[MeasureTheory] infix:80 " ∗ " => MeasureTheory.Measure.conv
```
Can you add simp attributes to those two theorems?

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - Convolution of measures
